workflow.name: Automate AI video production & distribution with Veo3, YouTube & Google Suite
workflow.description:
*This workflow contains community nodes that are only compatible with the self-hosted version of n8n.*

# Generate Veo3 Videos via AI/ML API, Save to Google Drive and Upload to YouTube

Transform your content creation process by automating video generation with AI, publishing to YouTube, and logging results in Google Sheets. This workflow is ideal for content creators, marketers, and social media managers looking to streamline video production and distribution.

## How it works

1. **Trigger**: Start the workflow manually or on a scheduled interval (e.g., every hour).
2. **Generate Video**: Send a request to the AI/ML API to create video content based on predefined prompts and settings.
3. **Monitor Status**: Poll the AI/ML API until the video generation is completed, with retry logic for reliability.
4. **Download & Upload**: Retrieve the generated video file and upload it to your connected YouTube channel.
5. **Title Generation**: Generate a YouTube title using AI to optimize for engagement.
6. **Log Results**: Update a Google Sheet with video metadata and the YouTube URL for tracking and analytics.

## Set up steps

1. **Connect Credentials**: Add OAuth2 credentials for AI/ML API, YouTube, and Google Sheets in n8n Credentials.
2. **Configure Nodes**: Rename nodes for clarity (e.g., `Generate Video`, `Upload to YouTube`) and set up the HTTP Request node to use your AI/ML API credential.
3. **Sheet Preparation**: Create a Google Sheet with columns for `Date`, `Prompt`, `Video ID`, and `YouTube URL`.
4. **Schedule**: If using scheduling, configure the Schedule Trigger interval (e.g., every 60 minutes).
5. **Test & Deploy**: Run a manual trigger, verify video generation, upload, and sheet entry, then activate the workflow for automation.

parameters.content:
## STEP 1: SET UP YOUR GOOGLE SHEET

1. **Create the Sheet**
   * Copy [this template](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1PXFCgY9zKHjX0HEhtrjMMiwefuwUP-bHIbwJ1gc-cAI/edit?usp=sharing)

2. **Configure Inputs**
   * **PROMPT** column ‚Üí Enter the exact 

3. **Leave Outputs Blank**
   * **VIDEO** column ‚Üí Leave empty; your generated video URL will be populated here automatically once creation is complete.


With this sheet in place, you‚Äôll trigger the rest of the workflow‚Äîfrom AI video generation to YouTube upload‚Äîdirectly from these entries.

## STEP 4: MAIN FLOW

1. **Trigger the Workflow**
   * You can kick off the process **manually** by clicking **Run** on the **Main Flow**.
   * **Or** attach a **Schedule Trigger** node to automate execution.

2. **Configure the Schedule Trigger**
   * Set the interval to **every 5 minutes** for near‚Äëreal‚Äëtime processing.
   * Adjust as needed depending on your volume and quota.

Once the trigger fires, the flow will:
* Read new rows from your Google Sheet
* Generate AI videos via Google‚ÄØVeo3
* Save output to Google‚ÄØDrive
* Optimize titles with GPT‚Äë4o
* Upload to YouTube
* Log results back into the sheet‚Äîall hands‚Äëfree.

## STEP 2: OBTAIN YOUR API KEY

1. **Sign Up & Retrieve Key**
   * Go to¬†[https://aimlapi.com/app/keys](https://aimlapi.com/app/keys?utm_source=n8n-workflows&utm_medium=github&utm_campaign=integration) 
   * Create or log in to your account and copy your API key.

2. **Configure ‚ÄúCreate Image‚Äù Node**
   * **Authentication Type:**¬†Bearer YOUR_TOKEN_HERE
   * **Header Name:**¬†Authorization
   * **Header Value:**¬†Key¬†`YOURAPIKEY`

Once saved, this key will authorize all subsequent calls to the AI/ML API in your workflow.
Set API Key created in Step 2

## STEP 3: CONFIGURE YOUTUBE UPLOAD

1. **Obtain Your Upload-Post API Key**
   * Sign in at [https://app.upload-post.com/](https://app.upload-post.com/)
   * Under **Manage API Keys**, copy your key (you get 10 free uploads/month).

2. **Set the Auth Header**
   * **Header Name:** `Authorization`
   * **Header Value:** `Apikey YOUR_API_KEY_HERE`

3. **Create & Select a Profile**
   * In Upload‚ÄëPost, create one or more ‚ÄúProfiles‚Äù to represent your YouTube accounts.
   * When configuring the upload node, choose the profile name (e.g. `test1` or `test2`) and insert it into the `YOUR_USRNAME` field.

Once these are in place, the workflow‚Äôs upload node will authenticate and publish videos under the specified profile.

**AI Video Automation: Google Veo3 ‚Üí Google Drive ‚Üí YouTube**

**This end‚Äëto‚Äëend workflow fully automates your AI video pipeline:**

1. **AI Video Generation**
   * Trigger video creation with Google Veo3 directly from a Google Sheet.

2. **Save to Google Drive**
   * Automatically store completed videos in a specified Drive folder.

3. **Title Optimization**
   * Leverage GPT‚Äë4o to generate SEO‚Äëfriendly YouTube titles.

4. **Automatic YouTube Upload**
   * Publish videos via the YouTube API with metadata populated.

5. **Tracking & Reporting**
   * Log upload status, video IDs, and performance metrics back into the Sheet.

parameters.prompt:
=You are a YouTube SEO expert specialized in creating engaging and optimized titles.

Your task is to generate an effective title for a YouTube video based on the user's video description.

GUIDELINES:
- Maximum 60 characters to avoid truncation
- Use relevant keywords for SEO
- Make the title catchy and clickable
- Avoid excessive or misleading clickbait
- Consider the target audience of the content
- Use numbers, questions, or power words when appropriate
- IMPORTANT: Generate the title in the same language as the input description

OUTPUT FORMAT:
Provide only the title, without additional explanations.

EXAMPLE:
Input: "Tutorial video on how to cook perfect pasta carbonara"
Output: "PERFECT Carbonara in 10 Minutes - Chef's Secrets"

Input: {{ $('Get new video').item.json.PROMPT }}

parameters.content: Set API Key created in Step 2
Create and insert link to your `output` GoogleDrive folder

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
